Package com.atakmap.map.layer.model.obj

Class ObjUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.map.layer.model.obj.ObjUtils
  • public final class ObjUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Various utilities used for the parsing of Obj files or Zipped Obj Files.

    • Method Detail

      • findFirst

        public static java.io.File findFirst​(java.io.File f,
                                     java.lang.String ext)
        Used as a last ditch effort to find a file that might be appropriate for a model. In this example a model was generated, but the xyz and prj files do not have the correct name. This is a case insensitive search.
        Parameters:
        f - the directory or zip file to
        ext - the specific extension to look for when searching
        Returns:
        the first occurance of a match for the extension based on the directory or zip file.

      • findObj

        public static java.io.File findObj​(ZipVirtualFile f)

      • findFile

        public static java.io.File findFile​(java.io.File directory,
                                    java.lang.String base,
                                    java.lang.String[] exts)
        Given a directory, basename and a set of extensions, return the first file that exists in a directory and matches.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory to look in.
        base - the name of the file without the extension.
        exts - a list of extensions.

      • copyStreamToString

        public static java.lang.String copyStreamToString​(java.io.File f)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • findMaterialLibrary

        public static java.io.File findMaterialLibrary​(java.io.File obj)
        Search an OBJ file for the "mtllib" definition
        Returns:
        .mtl file or null if not found

      • findMaterials

        public static java.util.Set<java.io.File> findMaterials​(java.io.File mtl)
        Find all linked materials within an MTL file
        Parameters:
        mtl - .mtl file
        Returns:
        List of materials
